>One thing that does bother me though is that to be /really/ good some
>kind of adaptive (e.g. hebbian)network would be required. So if for
>example there was a partial mechanical failure the NN could adapt (as a
>human would) to controling the system with it's new dynamics

How about making the simulation slightly randomised as regards the
capabilities of the vehicle? (ie. Each training run would involve a vehicle
with slightly different acceleration, or maybe a wheel not working, or
something like that.) That way, the network would evolve to have a degree of
flexibility, and determine its capabilities from its sensory feedback. In
fact, if you slightly randomised your physical laws too, this might allow
the network to better deal with the inevitable differences between the
simulation and the real world, when it was placed into the vehicle.

--Darren
